text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion specifically addresses the right not to have a work falsely attributed (s.84 CDPA) and states that this right applies to the person whose name is wrongly used. The candidate answer discusses copyright infringement related to scraping, derivative works (the ad), and the lack of registration. It does not mention or analyze the moral right of integrity or paternity under the CDPA, specifically Section 84 (False Attribution of Authorship), which is the subject of this criterion. Therefore, the criterion is not satisfied.", "criterion_id": "b18b6758-1ae6-44c6-b6fe-3f5bc295de82"}
